I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:

narratives.question_text: Please identify the teaching assistant with whom you interacted most closely _____________________ .
comments: Amanda Loudsbury
Anthony Clark
Not on the list.
Instructor: Anthony Philip Straub  Tony Straub
Instructor: Anthony Philip Straub  Tony Straub
Instructor: Thomas Alan Kwan  He is very responsive and helpful.
Instructor: Thomas Alan Kwan  Thomas Kwan
Instructor: Thomas Alan Kwan  I interacted the most with Thomas and Anthony Clark.

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: This class felt like 5 different classes in one. There was the lecture vein, which I didn't even really need to show up to because anyone who took even one environmental studies/public health class in undergrad would know all the subjects they cover (not surprising that it is an undergrad cross-listed course); there was a group work vein, which was the real heart of the class (designing and building stuff); and then there were these mini assignments every once in a while that seemed to have no rhyme or reason.

Lectures were painfully slow and material was very basic. The majority of the group work was also slow and unchallenging. More time, including class time, should have been devoted to the final project.

I wish the course would have spent less time on trying to lecture on the various topics associated with green manufacturing and instead would have allowed the groups more time to work in class with the help of the professors. Also I wish that the schedule would have allowed more time to actually work on the final product and maybe we could have had intermediate presentations. The expectations for the final product were not clear.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: Blue Juice Project
The creative side of designing/building.
Practicality of material and hands on experience
Final project
Useful knowledge and application of the design process.
The final project, especially my team!
My group was fantastic and made this class good.
The Blue Juice Assignment was particularly helpful in introducing green design concepts and tools on small scale prior to needing to emulate them on a group designed product.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: Pacing, project overlap, etc.
I think the final project needs to be started as soon as possible so the assignments/syllabus/scheduling should reflect that.
Lectures and HW

Course material was rarely relevant to project work. generally, the course was poorly structured. In many cases, the readings did not compliment the lectures and the lectures did not compliment the project work. Seemed as though the instructors were trying to do too much at once.
The lecture content was sometimes too basic for graduate students, especially FES students
Not having as many lectures.

The course made me very comfortable with understanding the green design process. However, certain aspects including material selection, material innovations, mechanics, etc. (all of which were presented in a very interactive and innovative way) could have been been more substantive.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: N/A -- no lab.

narratives.question_text: What were the strengths and weaknesses of your teaching assistant
comments: Not on list.
Instructor: Anthony Philip Straub  Tony was extremely responsive and friendly! He could have given us more constructive feedback or new ideas on our project though.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: Well, I'm not sure it did. Energy people need not fret about missing this class. I still think it was a good idea to take it, as the creative side of it was useful.
Extremely relevant
The course allowed me the chance to work on skills that I wanted to continue to develop.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: To learn more about engineering and creative design. I was also hoping my design would be good enough to run with as a start up one day.
To better understand and practice the product design process.
To learn about innovation/product design from a sustainability perspective
It seemed like it would allow me the opportunity to think differently.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Kind of. I was that there was more hands on engineering learning. I think there should really be two classes out of this one -- the lecture should have been about materials and machining and tools, but it was about green chemistry/environmental health. Granted, that is VERY important but it should be a different class, in my opinion.
Yes

No. I did not really learn the heavy quantitative aspects of the green engineering process. For example, I cannot do an LCA (nor was I really expecting to learn this). But I feel like we wasted time on this topic. Instead, it should have been a smaller or larger part of the course. I feel thatwe got a high level view of too many topics, most of which students will forget by the fall.
Yes
Not really.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Advantages: the project couldn't be done without a group.Disad: one person in the group was awful to work with.
Get more done, work with a multiskilled, diverse team to come up with better answers and work products.
Necessary part of the course.
My group was amazing! I got to work with Yale undergrads for the first time, which I really enjoyed.
I had a fantastic group. It made all the difference.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Great if you've never looked at the intersection of products, environment, and health.Also great if you're a DYI kind of person.
Get started on your project assignments earlier rather than later
Valuable but needs significant improvement. On the right track and Yale needs more courses like this one.
Take the final project really seriously because it's worth it!
